review:
I have purchased the TV on FK as it was on deal, otherwise I would have bought it here itself.
1.Great Display at this price. Pictures look clear and crisp and color balance is good.
2. I have seen TCL, SANYO, Micromax, Philips, Videocon and VU has amazing built with amazingly thin back panel and good quality of Plastic. Remote quality is also decent.
3. The sound is not great on this TV, as the price paid is not much I would just ignore the sound at the moment.
4. As Menu could have been better and while playing movies from USB, if you stop it starts again from start, also to reach a point you need to either forward or remember the lapse time where you left.
5. Most of the ports are in Side which need regular connectivity. 2 USB, 2 HDMI which are well spaces, so that I plug in my Chrome cast and Fire TV at a time.
6. 60 Hz, which is good for this price. Higher refresh rate means more smooth rendering and it fails at few places when I played a Blue ray/4K video with slow camera panning colors overlap, not a big failure at all. No impact on Fast moving scenes and Gaming.
7. Works well with PS3 for smooth game play, CHROMECAST connected without any issues and great picture on full HD rendering
8. The installation took 3 days of time and I am quite disappointed with multiple follow ups
9. 1 Years warranty is good and competitive

10.Great VALUE for MONEY. VU is a good brand and is offering good product at best price.
Final Verdict – Go for it, if you are looking for a good picture quality with great sounds and have a Budget constraint
I hope my review was helpful!

I purchased this tv in BBD Sale.......i got it at very attractive price...before taking this review bit deeep....overview is:
1. Flipkart Service 10/10 amazing
2. TV quality 09/10
3. Installation 09/10

1.FLIPKART SERVICE: I ordered it on 20.08.2017 & it was delivered on 22.08.2017 with great packing.
2.TV QUALITY: Before Purchasing this i was confused Between VU & LG & the price difference was about 50% but concidering reviews i decided to purchase VUTV.
i used this tv for 10 days & trust me its a must buy TV.

PROS:
Great Picture Quality
Can extend warrenty upto 3 years with nominal charges
Sound is loud enough but if you want theatre kind experience use music system with this
(i am using F&D 550x with this & experience is awesome)
almost every format video can be played through USB/Pendrive
WIDE CONNECTIVITY: 2 X USB, 2 X HDMI, VGA, AUDIO IN, AUDIO OUT ETC
Can use Chrome cast & fire tv stick to experience smart tv
Value for money Product.

CONS:
Built Quality is not up to the mark.
User Interface & Media Player could have been better.


Final Verdict – Dont Worry.....Go for it.

I bought this Vu led tv (model no. H40D321) from flipkart on 21.09.2017 and installed on 23.09.17. On 10.1017 , suddenly there was a sound of small burst in the tv and the display went off. Thereafter, i switched off the tv and switched it on again a visible mark on the screen appeared. I lodged a complaint regarding the incident with Vu customer care vide no.133926. On 12
10.17, the engineer visited my residence and i narrated the whole thing to him but he said that u have damaged the display to which i replied that there is not even a single scratch on the screen from outside, if anything was hit on it there would have been some kind of impact mark on the screen. He further said that the display cannot be replaced. I am very disappointed with the customer service. I bought this led tv on 21 september 2017 with high hopes from Vu but customer service is awful. I feel cheated and would never recommend vu led tvs to anyone. I had also used lg samsung led tvs who had better customer service. I would not suggest the customers to buy vu led tvs. So freinds, dont go for cheap rates rather go for brands like lg samsung sony. Utterly disappointed. I bought the led tv on 21 sept 2017 for Rs 18499 but all my money has is wasted as vu customer care has informed me that fault is yours.

Nikhil Dogra

Got the product at right time .thanks to Flipkart and when it comes to installation though it was late by 2 r 3 days Flipkart responded in a good way... quality wise our satisfaction will exceed our expectations ...with in our budget.......

Definitely a big Deal 👏 ! @21999 (VU 39 FHD)
Guys this TV I got on June 18. Until now its completely fine. And the quality of the TV is on par with the other branded products like Samsung/Sony with respect to the picture quality especially the HD channels are too good.And even the frame of the TV is so thin that it looks like a premium TV.

Even the extended warranty you can get from Jeeves for additional 2 years for Rs 2150. So you get a total of 3 years warranty. Just go for it

Will add more details after some time...!

I have booked TV on 25 Sep 17 for Kanpur U.P. in 18400rs.. delivered on 01 oct 17 at 12 pm packing was extremely good.. and installed on 02 oct 17 at 11 am. I'm satisfied with delivery and installation.. 5/5
Now comes on TV..
Build quality- 4/5 totally plastic.. which is not give u gazab look..
Picture quality- 4/5 best in this price.. but not superb.. u ll feel ur self wn u ll see Sony and LG picture quality.
Sound quality- 3/5 VU have too improve here.. Bcoz sound is loud enough for 15x15 room.. but not clear.. ( which my mammy complaining )
Connectivity- 4/5 DTH is working fine.. While connecting with 3.5 MM headphone jack to home theater 5.1 .. humming sound is coming.

Pros..
Everything in this price range is just Wow.. I belong to a small town Kanpur.. where ppl don't go for new brands easily..
Google Cromecast 2 is working superbly ( screen mirroring too )
Bezzels are very thin.. which give to Sony 43W772E look.
Extended warranty is a good deal ( if u have kids in home or used TV more than 4hrs in a day ) I have taken 2 years extended warranty in 1452rs.
Cons..
Sound is not good.. Quality of remote is very cheap.. and TV is lil bit thick..
Go for it guys.. in this price range.. u ll not get this type of best deal. Thank you Flipkart.
If u find this review helpful..than give a thumbs up.. Thank you.

At 22k it's a very good deal. Only Audio is an issue , it is not that loud. But yeah I am satisfied with it. Otherwise all other feaures etc are good. Played different different format of HD videos, performance is decent.

Long term Review update:

I am updating review after more than 1 year of use :)
I am happy with the TV performance. It is really a good one with good quality.
Thanks VU TV to make such a beautiful product.
Much better than Samsung LEDs.

The delivery of ekart and installation by Jeeves was excellent which was done on the same day of delivery. I was impressed by the quality of picture and sound in the tv. It's a perfect VFM product. Till now didn't find any cons for this product. Perfect LED TV for people switching from CRT TV to LED TV .

Picture quality is too bad. Worse than LCD. Very poor refresh rate. You can see the glitchs when watching any even normal fast moving sports or song. You will see multiple ghost of the ball in case you are watching hockey or cricket. Picture quality in HD Channels is some what ok but in case of normal channels it is pathetic. You will see a very blurred image and watching any fast moving song or sports is a nightmare in normal channels. In HD picture is a little clear but poor refresh rate is very much visible in normal viewing. Had requested for return but Flipkart dont have any return policy. On complaining their technician visited and informed that this is only for HD viewing. Normal broadcasting channels are not supported by this TV. They informed that one will get only this much at this price. Their claim of refresh rate and A grade is complete falsh. Regretting buying this TV. I suggest go for a better brand and that too after seeing the actual product rather than trusting any one without seeing the product. Regretting the decision to buy this TV.

The product is awesome. But, the service by flipkart is pathetic. No proper communication form the support team. The guy who came for installation seemed less knowledgeable about the product had limited reply to whatever I asked. If you are planning to by a separate wall mount, even the one suggested by flipkart, they are not allowed to install was mentioned by the Jeeves installation guy. I purchased this TV with additional warranty of 3 years, the support team, the delivery guys and the Jeeves guy had no proper answer as to how will I get the confirmation of the extended warranty. I still have no answer. Please call.

It's hooked up as a HDMI-connected monitor, the viewing distance is ~10 feet. For me the budget was critical, and the distance meant the largest available (cheap) 32" PC monitor would still be too small. First the good stuff:

1. The build quality is above average at this price level. The casing doesn't creak and the gaps are uniform and small.

2. The sound quality is usable for basic YouTube and Prime Video. Will not shake the earth, but the vocal quality is intelligible and there is a coaxial output to hook up a receiver or DAC. This reduces the amount of cabling, and provides the option of not using the internal speakers at all. The coaxial is a nice unexpected bonus,

3. Picture quality is above average for internet video, and so it will be for satellite TV as well. The colour is about average but the panel itself is probably very narrow gamut. For broadcast this will probably not be an issue.

4. The price itself is very low. It is well below the price of any other 'branded' TV and the brand itself has been around for a bit,.

5. Flipkart delivery and service was outstanding, a marked improvement from what it was six months ago. Very impressed with the quick turnaround - I doubt a local store purchase would have been as efficient.

Now the bad stuff:

1. The front panel indicator light is way too bright. It actually hurt after ten minutes so I had to tape it over with some foam so I could actually look at the screen.

2. With the screen blanked, there is enough backlight bleed to light a reasonably sized room. The power LED is not really needed once the TV is on - and the black levels are correspondingly poor. This is an issue with almost every IPS display including professional ones, but it's usually not this bad. There are lots of bright areas at the periphery, indicating poor polariser performance.

3. The colour while good enough for broadcast, falls short of a proper 8 bpp target. The internal engine is either not using FRC, or the panel is even lower grade than I initially thought. The gamut is also very narrow, the Red is very far off target and the Green is poor - though better than red. Blue is the only colour that is on target, but part of that may be due to the bluish backlight, which is a feature of almost all cheap TVs. The quality of the LEDs in the backlight is very poor, leading to a gamut tilted towards blue. After calibration the colours came closer to the target but you can't fix inherent panel issues this way.

4. The processing engine in the TV is hyperactive, always trying to sharpen or enhance the image, but it trips over its own tail at times. There is some amount of resampling that makes games respond very poorly, with slow frame transitions in low contrast areas. The panel is touted as 60Hz, which is probably the drive frequency for the backlight. The engine is not capable of over 30Hz internally and the result is a light stutter/blur when moving between areas. I suspect this will be a problem in very fast or dark scenes as well.

5. The weakest part of the TV is the firmware. The software fails to save the user-selected zoom setting, which means you have to manually scale from your display, or live with a bit of overscan at the default 16:9 setting. Broadcast and console users will probably not even notice, but those who have it hooked up to a HTPC will either have to rescale the display resulting in loss of 1:1 pixel mapping, or set the zoom every single power-up. The firmware also offers no options for custom white balance, which would have gone a long way in fixing the TVs off-colour gamut to some extent. Whereas the processing engine and panel cost money - and thus can still be forgiven in a TV at this price, there is no excuse for poor firmware.

Overall it’s an excellent product in this price range. But USB media player has some issue regarding the aspect ratio. So for those who like to watch movies using USB, please note the below issue before buying the same.

There is no option to keep the source aspect ratio while using USB media player. It works fine with videos which are in 16:9 aspect ratio. In most scenarios we can see that source file of movies now a days are in 21:9 (or not in 16:9 exactly) and in these cases the videos looks vertically stretched in order to fit its 16:9 aspect ratio, creating distorted images. There is no option in menu to keep the Source Aspect Ratio, while using USB media player.

In order to update/fix the USB media player bug, I have logged a complaint with VU customer support with Call No. VU145701 dated 08 Nov 2017, but no updates as of now.

Pros:
- Excellent picture quality, comparable to top brands like Samsung and Sony.
- remote and consecutive actions are responsive and fast
- playing files from usb is pleasant experience (subtitles get detected automatically)

Cons:
- average speakers, you should invest in good quality speaker, don't rely on 3.5mm port on tv, go for av/HDMI to 3.5 mm converter with splitter
- it's not slim at all... In smaller rooms it may look weird hooked up on wall
- my pendrive attached to USB port gets really hot... So careful not to leave it there

Giving 5 stars Couldn't get better deal at this price.

I am fully satisfied.

Pros:

The display clarity is as good as many other popular brands' TVs.

Cons:

The EQ has only bass and treble. They could have provided other Hz as well.

In some branded TVs, when you connect an external speaker through the 3.5 audio out, you will have the option to choose whether the TV speaker should still sound or should be muted. Because, you don't want to watch TV serial in 5.1 surround speaker, but you will wish to watch your favorite Hollywood movie in it. You cant just keep plug and unplug the audio out every time. (1) It is not easy to reach the plug, (2) It will damage the port. Using this feature, you can just keep the external speaker plugged in all the time, and while watching serial, you can turn on TV speaker and for movies turn on the surround speaker and turn off the TV speaker. Since the slim LED TVs cant accommodate huge speakers, pretty much every TV has very average sound (And no bass whatsoever) and for this reason people tend to go for external speaker. Therefore this feature is a basic need.

I am saddened to see this TV does not have this feature, even many other popular brand TVs don't. I wish VU reads this and provides this basic feature in all the TVs.

Everything good from flipkart and jeeves side, This is my second vu 40 in led tv bought from flipkart. If any body planning to buy 40 in led tv within the budget simply go for it.

It was a good transition for me from 32" Samsung LED to 39" Vu. To be honest, the first thing that attracted me was the price tag, and topped with the SBI debit card offer this was an offer hard to miss. It was really a deal at Rs 18500. To be safe, I had also purchased a 2 year warranty from Jeeves, just in case :) . Also the reviews from Vu customers prompted to go for it.

The following are my observations after 2 days of use:
PROS:
a. Delivery super fast, and the installation by Jeeves was very professional.
b. Very thin bezel, giving it a sleek and premium look.
c. Colour rendition is top class.
d. Plays all video formats. (Played Avatar bluray rip, and the experience was awesome)
e. Interface very friendly.
f. Build quality is very good - Comparably to Samsung or Sony.

CONS:
a. The HDMI ports seem difficult to access, I have to move the TV to change HDMI cable.
b. Sound is a major disappointment. The max volume is just OK for a medium sized room. Will not be sufficient for a bigger hall. This can be addressed with a speaker system though.
c. Sound clarity could have been improved.

However going by the price tag, the cons can be overlooked. The same size LED from Samsung or Sony would have been priced atleast 35 K or more. So I feel this was a good decision. I hope Vu does not let me down in future ;)

I bought this TV from Flipkart and it was delivered without hassle. The packaging was proper and they even sent an engineer the next day to help with the installation (which was not required for me though).

Pros.
1. Picture quality is awesome
2. Dual HDMI, Dual USB slot for multiple devices
3. PS4 works smoothly
4. Hard drives connect without any difficulty. A little practice required with the remote control
5. The sound is good enough for a small house. Lot of people have complained here that the sound is less. If the room is too big, buy a bigger TV.
6. Both wall mount and table top options are there. Dont try the wall mount yourself
7. Awesome prices

Con.
1. Remote control is flimsy
2. If you are installing table top on your own, you get two stands and both are marked R and L. The R goes to the left and L goes to the right if u r facing the screen of the TV. It took me 15-20 mins to figure it out

In a nutshell, go for this product

VFM deal. Everything about this TV invites you to get one but do remember if you are going to stick to normal standard channels(SD) or non HD channels then go for 32 inch. The SD channels are not pleasant to watch though watchable. If you opt for HD channels then you have a sweet deal. Rest you can watch from pen drives ,hard drives,fire stick or chromecast. Speakers are OK. Remote is basic and good quality. All the plastics used on the TV are satisfactorily good.

Delivery and installation was pretty good on time execution...

Most of my relatives, friends and neighbour says me that I have a good knowledge of technology. So I want to share my opinion. First LED TV was launched by Samsung and then Sony says that TV which SAMSUNG launched is LCD not LED. But after some time all world knows about the power of LED resolution. After that Samsung and Sony developed LED by this their technology. By using Sony bravia engine, the quality of Sony is slight better than Samsung. But price is higher. LG was on 3rd rank amongst them. Later on LG starts using IPS display, which makes LG company absolutely winner from Sony a d Samsung. Friends viewing experience on IPS display is much much better, it reduces blurness if u are watching normal SD channel. But if r watching HD then it is superb and incredible experience. So now it's clear that we required a TV of IPS panel. Now the question is that, which brand we have to buy. Now friends if I cover 10 mobiles from top and downside of branded or chinese then it will be impossible to identify them, which is branded or chinese or Indian brand. It means now all are using standard and common component. So there is no issue to purchase Vu. You can't say Vu a small brand because this company doing so well in LEDs. My friends are using since last 1.5 years. If u don't have money problem, u go for major brands. I suggest u to go for LG now. But if u are a intelligent customer, then go for Vu.

Picture quality is decent in both HD & SD versions. Sound is decent for a standard bedroom size. Contrast is decent as well. The TV responds quickly to any new connection added. However, the on screen user interface is tad primitive, lackluster and little lagging. Could had been better designed and given better look and feel.

Overall, I feel it's a steal deal at this price and value for money product that provides with all requirements that's available with any popular brand. Only time will say how it outperforms other brands, but until now it's a good TV to go with at this price range.

Though I found the product to be really good, I had a pathetic experience with Flipkart’s delivery.

I ordered this LED on an exchange offer. The product was delivered on promised date and the installation guy also arrived on the same day. However, when the LED was unboxed, the guy realised that the screen was damaged. In checking the box, he found a perforation covered with a tape- implying a deliberate attempt to conceal the damage. I was promised an exchange. So far so good.

The replacement date that was committed to me was 7 days ahead of this day. Calling the customer care to expedite the replacement date was unhelpful. Mind you- they had already taken away my existing LED as an exchange product. Basically I was left without a TV for a week - which included a long weekend - for no fault of mine. Again, I accepted this as my bad luck.

Now the LED is delivered on promised date, and the installation is scheduled on the same day. I receive a call and the person on the other side says that the installation couldn’t happen that day since the technicians had left for the day. Immediately thereafter I receive an SMS saying that “As per my request, the installation has been rescheduled”. I had specially asked someone to stay back at home to receive the LED. I call up the customer care explaining the inconvenience I have been going through and the unethical nature of the reschedule request. The person says that I note your feedback and then went at length to explain me basically the business model of Flipkart- how it is a marketplace and does not have control on every part of the process. I tried explaining that his explanation isn’t helping me solve my problem and that I at least deserve an apology- at least for the 5 times that I had to arrange someone to stay back at home. I was told that I could ask my “brother/ sister” and that I need to be physically there to receive the product.

What I can conclude from my experience is that Flipkart has no control over its logistic partners and customer service. If you are lucky (which I had been till now) then things go smoothly. If not, then Flipkart is unable to manage the exigency and you land up in a mess. Lesson learnt- Never order heavy appliances from Flipkart. Rather- AVOID Flipkart!

Pros:
-Product is good for the price. I took it in an exchange offer.
-Weight of the TV is light and the bezel is thin so it makes the screen look big.
-Various connectivity ports are easily accessible
- Picture quality is pretty good for the price once all the crucial settings and calibration are done
- The remote is of a decent size and has a decent feel to it.

Cons:
- Many important settings in the TV are disabled by the company. We need to enter the service menu to enable these settings. Especially by default skin tones show a unnatural pink color (known as Pink Effect). This can be adjusted once you access the relevant settings via the Service Menu. Details on How to enter the service menu is easily available via Google.

-A lot of buyers have complained about the sound and speaker quality and volume but they fail to understand that such thin Led TV will have a limitation in the size of speakers they can incorporate inside the body. You always have an option to use an external sound bar.

- Another distinct negative is the cloudy white patches seen on the screen when there is no signal. At first it may seem as if the screen panel is faulty but once a signal is received and something comes on the screen the patch disappears.

.

.

.

One main thing none of the button for this tv( except power button) Only control through remote only.

Suitable settings :
For display : colour 45, contrast 65 brightness 43, sharpness 50, or kept it on mild mode. Most important backlight must be 80 only . default backlight is set at 98%. If u want to use this tv more time pls set it to 90% using system another menu.
Remote is like dvd player remote, must improve .
Sound mode : keep MUSIC mode.

Voltage stabilizer is a must for this tv. In indian power condition voltage will fluctuating up to 300 volts also. But this tv pworking in 100 to 240 volts only. Be-aware of this.

Usb mode : full hd video is having flickering while showing some colour like green forest or silver and gold ornments etc.

Sound is very loud, no need to connect external speaker, sounds very very clear and very very loud.fully satisfied. 3)you can easily connect 2 pendrives, and also fire tv stick and Google chromecast in hdmi ports works superb, i connected my Xbox with hdmi cable, my gaming experience is superb, i will give 5 out of 5. 4)tv can play and support almost all kinds of video formats and it also has resume support features, you can also play mp3 files, and the user interface of the tv is very good, it also supports subtitles files, you can view pictures using usb and also can read text files.5)build quality of the tv looks premium, bezels are also thin at the bottom a small vu logo is present, i like the design. Now cons are-1)it is a bit difficult to access the hdmi ports when you wall mount the tv. 2)remote of the tv works looks and feels plasticy and cheap in design but works very fine.

Writing this review for those who buy VU tv considering it a value buy... Exactly after 2 years 8 months, the motherboard has crashed, as suggested by vu engineer... Obviously the brand would say, electronic items have some predefined life, but when you compare them in same category, a TV losing its main hardware in 2 to 3 years after paying high price is not acceptable... Especially when a Samsung or other good brand provide literally 10 years or more shelf life!!! So a discount of 20 to 30% over established brand doesn't really pays off in a long run... VU please improve your quality else you will create a pile of e-waste for Indians to handle!!
And ofcourse, can't blame flipkart as they already excel in pathetic service and low grade product trades... So beware!!

Good tv. Though few observations :
- sound quality very average
- only two HDMI ports that too on back facing downwards.. difficult to plug in
- plays video well, online sites also accessible, plays flash videos as well

DELIVERY and PACKAGING was as expected of Flipkart. But the delivery person had a faulty payment machine. Flipkart should make it a point to keep electronic options open at delivery for higher purchases.

INSTALLATION was done within 24 hours of delivery. But a more friendly service engineer would have done no harm.

As for the TV, picture is quite alright. But the sound is less than average. Not only does it not have the stereophonic effects but also lacks clarity when it comes to spoken words and is pretty low even at full volume.
The AV and USB ports are at the side but the HDMI and VGA ports situated at the bottom are not easily accessible. Besides, the two hd ports are too close and you cannot have two chords fitted at the same time.

A GOOD BUY at its price, especially for the large screen that you get.

It's been almost 1.5 years iam using this tv and it's too good to use.

Installation and service provided is perfect and also on time.

Only difficulty which I faced is the USB slot(and other connectivity options like HDMI, etc), which is very hard to reach if the TV is wall mounted. This is a design issue, which can be resolved. No problem with the harware.

Overall this is a great deal.

Note - Iam using this TV in an average sized living room. I couldn't find any issues with sound too.

Best Budget TV!
I have purchased it on mid November and writing review after using it three months. I will not mention it's technical specification as flipkart have done wonderful work for that. Just refer to product description .
Delivery was before time (within 27 hours of placing order)
Installation was done on next day of delivery.
In box VU have supplied wall mounting brackets and table stand so no need to bother about all these things.
Coming to features of the TV , picture clarity is wonderful. It supports 1080p videos of all format however it lags on 4k as tv is not a 4k tv.
Sound is a bit low, but it will not create problem as there is option of audio out for home theater.
Also there is headfone out port of 3.5 mm .
Overall this is the TV which can be used in multipurpos, true value for money product. I recommend every one who is looking a big screen TV within budget under 20K.

I ordered vu 39 inch led during bigbillion sale 2017 and ot costed me 18500 only.The led was delivered very late app 15 to 20 days after the order was placed which spoiled all the excitement.But any how recieved it through bluedart and the installation guys came and installed the led witin 2days.Regarding the output of the led i would say that the picture clarity is good the colours are niether over nor under saturated infact somwhere near to natural unlike samsung led i already have which gives a whitish layer making colours dumb.The sound output is very good believe me i didnt expected it to be that loud with only 14 watt speakers.also speakers have a decent bass in them.i played HD and Full HD both videos and the videos played very well without any issue and sound output on fulk hd was fantastic.but if you are using it on cable tv without hd box the picture becomes blur so go for hd boxes before buying it .

I ordered this TV on Flipkart in Oct 2017 and got it within the time period mentioned. TV installation was also done promptly and professionally. The only thing which upset me was that the TV engineer was insisting that we purchase the additional warranty. Their engineer insisting on warranty does not reflect well about their confidence in their own product :-)
This Vu TV is working fine. The picture quality is good especially given the price of 20k INR. When I checked, there were a few not-so-positive reviews about the audio quality but I am very satisfied with the audio as well. Our viewing distance is around 8 feet and it works fine in our space. I am using Google Chromecast as well (to connect to mobile) and it works like a charm.
All in all, I would recommend this model to those who are not keen on spending too much on a LED TV.

To be honest, I was skeptical of buying a TV from a company that was unheard of. But, when I read all the reviews here, I started trusting the company and placed the order as the price was so lucrative.
Upon receiving, I was just awestruck by the panel quality. The panel quality like the colour reproduction and sharpness was nowhere less than any Samsung or Sony TV available at approx double the price.
So, anyone here having the same dilemma as I had, should really pick this TV and save your money.
Flipkart's delivery was fast and good as usual.
Jeeve's installation guy came next day, the TV was installed. I had opted for 1 + 2 years extended warranty and informed the installation guy about that, to which he responded, that I should save his mobile number and if in case any problem arrises, I can directly contact him as extended warranty is provided by their company only.

Hope my review will help many other customers before they choose their products with flipkart. My review is on flipkart's service and not about the product. I ordered an led tv online with flipkart which had decent offer. The product was supposed to be delivered to me on 8-9th Nov. When I didn't receive the product I filed a complaint by calling flipkart. Then I made call 2 day 2 then call 3 day 3 and so on till call 6. Everytime the discussion was same. No attempt was made from flipkart to contact the delivery partner. And they kept us waiting for the product with no progress. Finally I asked for the delivery partner and got their contact from Google. Upon checkin with them found that the delivery partner doesn't deliver to my place. And this they have communicated to flipcart time and again. Flipkart instead of making at attempt to know the root cause was asking me to cancel the order and loose some more time. The purpose of my review is 1- how do I escalate this issue to higher channel. 2- Any customer ordering some high priced good please be mindful about the unprofessional flipkart delivery service and any issues arising of it. Finally we had to go to warehouse and pick up our product which far away from our home.
